item.title: Expert on Public Financial Management
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Global objective:

The global objective of this assignment is to assess the implementation performance of the Support to the Implementation of the VLAP.

Specific objective(s):

The specific objectives of this assignment are:

  • To evaluate the Government of Moldova compliance with the General Conditions defined in Section 3 of Appendix 2 and the relevant Specific Conditions defined in Section 4 of Appendix 2 of the Financing Agreement on Support to the Implementation of the VLAP, for the disbursement of the 1st instalment (see the Financing Agreement attached).
  • To advise the European Commission on payment (total, partial, or non-payment) of the 1st instalment of the Support to the Implementation of the VLAP.

Expert on Public Financial Management

Qualifications and skills:

  • At least Master Degree in finance or economics, or a university degree in the above areas with equivalent professional experience of at least 10 years in the relevant field;
  • Knowledge of the EU procurement rules and excellent reporting and drafting skills;
  • Fluent in written and spoken English. Knowledge of Romanian or Russian would be an asset;
  • Knowledge of the Moldovan context would be an asset.

General and specific professional experience:

  • A minimum of 12 years of professional experience in Public Finance Management;
  • A minimum of 5 years of professional experience in public finance management agencies, preferably in CIS or/and a country covered by the European Neighbourhood Policy;
  • Extensive knowledge of the latest developments and best practices in public financial management;
  • Experience of working with various levels of Government;
  • Knowledge of EU external aid procedures, project cycle management principles and budget support methodology and evaluation;
  • Proven experience in performance assessment and review of EU budget support programmes;
  • Experience in project management and preparation.

item.title: Expert on Public Order and Security
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Global Objective:

The global objective of this assignment is to assess the implementation performance of the Support to the Implementation of the VLAP.

Specific objective(s):

The specific objectives of this assignment are:

  • To evaluate the Government of Moldova compliance with the General Conditions defined in Section 3 of Appendix 2 and the relevant Specific Conditions defined in Section 4 of Appendix 2 of the Financing Agreement on Support to the Implementation of the VLAP, for the disbursement of the 1st instalment (see the Financing Agreement attached).
  • To advise the European Commission on payment (total, partial, or non-payment) of the 1st instalment of the Support to the Implementation of the VLAP.

Expert on Public Order and Security

Qualifications and skills:

  • At least Master Degree in law or any filed related to security and law enforcement, or a university degree in the above areas with equivalent professional experience of at least 15 years in the relevant field;
  • Knowledge of the EU procurement rules and excellent reporting and drafting skills;
  • Fluent in written and spoken English. Knowledge of Romanian or Russian would be an asset;
  • Knowledge of the Moldovan context would be an asset.

General and specific professional experience

  • A minimum of 12 years of professional experience in security and law enforcement area;
  • A minimum of 5 years of professional experience in law enforcement agencies, preferably in CIS or/and a country covered by the European Neighbourhood Policy;
  • Extensive knowledge of the latest developments and best practices in fighting organized crime and Intelligence-led Policing;
  • Experience of working with various levels of Government;
  • Knowledge of EU external aid procedures, project cycle management principles and budget support methodology and evaluation;
  • Experience in performance assessment of EU budget support programmes;
  • ****Experience in project management and preparation.

item.title: Team leader/Expert on Border and Migration Management
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Global objective:

The global objective of this assignment is to assess the implementation performance of the Support to the Implementation of the VLAP.

Specific objective(s):

The specific objectives of this assignment are:

  • To evaluate the Government of Moldova compliance with the General Conditions defined in Section 3 of Appendix 2 and the relevant Specific Conditions defined in Section 4 of Appendix 2 of the Financing Agreement on Support to the Implementation of the VLAP, for the disbursement of the 1st instalment (see the Financing Agreement attached).
  • To advise the European Commission on payment (total, partial, or non-payment) of the 1st instalment of the Support to the Implementation of the VLAP.

Team leader/Expert on Border and Migration Management

Qualifications and skills

  • At least Master Degree in law or any filed related to border and migration management, or a university degree in the above areas with equivalent professional experience of at least 15 years in the relevant field;
  • Knowledge of the EU procurement rules and excellent reporting and drafting skills;
  • Fluent in written and spoken English. Knowledge of Romanian or Russian would be an asset;
  • Knowledge of the Moldovan context would be an asset.

General and specific professional experience:

  • A minimum of 12 years of professional experience in border or migration management;
  • A minimum of 5 years of professional experience in border or migration agencies, preferably in CIS or/and a country covered by the European Neighbourhood Policy;
  • Extensive knowledge of the latest developments and best practices in Integrated Border Management and migration policies;
  • Experience of working with various levels of Government;
  • Knowledge of EU external aid procedures, project cycle management principles and budget support methodology and evaluation;
  • Experience in performance assessment of EU budget support programmes;
  • Leadership skills to manage and motivate a team and to interact with project partners, the European Union Delegation to Moldova, civil society and the donor community;
  • Experience in project management and preparation.

item.title: Junior Expert in EU Development Policy/External Relations
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The objective of the project is to reinforce the Permanent Representation of the Ministry of Foreign affairs of Latvia in Brussels and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Riga for the duration of the Latvian EU Presidency.

Project duration: 9 months

Junior Expert in EU Development Policy/External Relations

  • university degree
  • Excellent Level of English
  • Good Level of French
  • Knowledge of Latvian is an advantage
  • Excellent drafting, communication and organisational skills
  • at least 3 years’ experience in the area of development policy/ external relations
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work under pressure and with short deadlines
  • Knowledge of EU institutions and their working procedures
  • Prior experience in previous EU council presidencies, including in preparing the EU foreign affairs council/ Development segment will be considered as an asset
  • Excellent knowledge of and prior experience in the following: post - 2015 agenda for poverty eradication and sustainable development, including development related to gender issues, financing for development, ACP and CODEV Council working group-related matters

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Nicolas_fichers@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Global Tertiary Education Specialist
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Australia has established the Regional Advisory Service (RAS) to provide regional organisations, their island members and the DFAT Pacific regional program with timely and efficient access to a small pool of experts to support. Beyond the use of individual advisers, this integrated approach to structuring their use of such expertise will improve coordination and networking amongst regional organisations, and with national priorities in member states. It will also more readily enable common themes, challenges and synergies to be identified and addressed in a coherent and efficient way.

The RAS will offer the following:

  • A vehicle for joint analysis and learning on the major issues and challenges identified through regional organisation governing bodies, policy dialogue and elsewhere.
  • Access to a pool of experts (or other inputs and activities) that can be mobilised to work with one or across a number of regional organisations, with member states and with the Australian government or jointly in the following areas: strategic planning, governance, monitoring and evaluation, audit and risk management.
  • A help desk function, where technical staff are available remotely throughout the year for up to 20 days per year. Typical tasks include specific technical advice, reviewing technical documents produced and joint-assessment of technical issues. This function should only be used where the staff of regional organisations cannot address a problem themselves and would be moderated through the joint focal points in DFAT and the regional organisations.

DFAT will manage the RAS Team through the Suva hub as part of an enhanced engagement on Pacific Islands Regionalism. DFAT will work jointly with regional organisations and member states to determine their priorities for support including through High Level Consultations and regular discussions between focal points.

Global Tertiary Education Specialist

Essential Requirement:

Relevant qualification in international development, international relations or related discipline, and over 20 years’ experience in public sector policy, strategy and program management in development contexts.

Essential Occupational Experience:

  • Extensive knowledge of and a minimum of 20 years’ experience in international development;
  • Comprehensive knowledge of and experience with DFAT’s programming and corporate policies and operations;
  • Extensive experience working in development in the Pacific region;
  • Extensive knowledge of benchmarking, strategic planning and capacity building for establishing and improving tertiary education institutions

Highly desirable:

Experience of working with Pacific regional educational institutions.

The specialist is required for approximately 60 days’ input over two years.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting reference no. 7014046 in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

item.title: Spécialiste en Sciences et Techniques de Gestion Administrative (Cat. II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
L'objectif général de cette étude est de faire une analyse institutionnelle du MEDD et de proposer des options concrètes de restructuration et de renforcement des capacités en vue de repositionner le MEDD et ses structures au regard des évolutions du secteur pour mieux assumer ses missions et faire face aux enjeux internationaux relatifs à la restructuration de la gouvernance de l'environnement et du développement durable en cours.

Spécialiste en Sciences et Techniques de Gestion Administrative (Cat. II)

Formation Diplôme: master en droit public, option administration publique, ou management des administrations publiques, ou équivalent.

Expérience professionnelle:

  • Expérience d'au moins six (6) ans dans le domaine de l'administration publique, la gestion et la comptabilité publique.
  • Expérience en audit/conseil d'administration et de gestion dans des pays en développement notamment en Afrique francophone acquise au cours de trois études au moins (à justifier par des fiches de projets en annexe au CV).
  • Expérience de réorganisation institutionnelle à démontrer dans au moins cinq projets.
  • Expérience comme formateur dans au moins trois projets/études.
  • Pratique du français avérée par la conduite et la rédaction de rapports acquise au cours de cinq études au moins.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Francesca_Giordano@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
